AffinityInfo
AffinityInfo

Gets or sets a locality hint that can be used by the Batch service to select a compute node on which to start the new task.
ApplicationPackageReferences
ApplicationPackageReferences

Gets or sets a list of application packages that the Batch service will deploy to the compute node before running the command line.

Gets or sets the settings for an authentication token that the task can use to perform Batch service operations.

Gets or sets an object that indicates that the task is a multi-instance task, and contains information about how to run the multi-instance task.

Gets or sets a list of files that the Batch service will download to the compute node before running the command line.

Gets or sets the user identity under which the task runs.

      String

Properties

  • Edit
    AffinityInfo
    AffinityInfo

    Gets or sets a locality hint that can be used by the Batch service to select a compute node on which to start the new task.

    public AffinityInformation AffinityInfo { get; set; }Public Property AffinityInfo As AffinityInformation

    Property Value

    • AffinityInformation
      AffinityInformation
  • Edit
    ApplicationPackageReferences
    ApplicationPackageReferences

    Gets or sets a list of application packages that the Batch service will deploy to the compute node before running the command line.

    public IList<ApplicationPackageReference> ApplicationPackageReferences { get; set; }Public Property ApplicationPackageReferences As IList(Of ApplicationPackageReference)

    Property Value

    • IList<ApplicationPackageReference>
      IList(Of ApplicationPackageReference)
  • Edit
    AuthenticationTokenSettings
    AuthenticationTokenSettings

    Gets or sets the settings for an authentication token that the task can use to perform Batch service operations.

    public AuthenticationTokenSettings AuthenticationTokenSettings { get; set; }Public Property AuthenticationTokenSettings As AuthenticationTokenSettings

    Property Value

    • AuthenticationTokenSettings
      AuthenticationTokenSettings

    Remarks

    If this property is set, the Batch service provides the task with an authentication token which can be used to authenticate Batch service operations without requiring an account access key. The token is provided via the AZ_BATCH_AUTHENTICATION_TOKEN environment variable. The operations that the task can carry out using the token depend on the settings. For example, a task can request job permissions in order to add other tasks to the job, or check the status of the job or of other tasks under the job.

  • Edit
    CommandLine
    CommandLine

    Gets or sets the command line of the task.

    public string CommandLine { get; set; }Public Property CommandLine As String

    Property Value

    • String
      String

    Remarks

    For multi-instance tasks, the command line is executed as the primary task, after the primary task and all subtasks have finished executing the coordination command line. The command line does not run under a shell, and therefore cannot take advantage of shell features such as environment variable expansion. If you want to take advantage of such features, you should invoke the shell in the command line, for example using "cmd /c MyCommand" in Windows or "/bin/sh -c MyCommand" in Linux.

  • Edit
    Constraints
    Constraints

    Gets or sets the execution constraints that apply to this task.

    public TaskConstraints Constraints { get; set; }Public Property Constraints As TaskConstraints

    Property Value

    • TaskConstraints
      TaskConstraints

    Remarks

    If you do not specify constraints, the maxTaskRetryCount is the maxTaskRetryCount specified for the job, and the maxWallClockTime and retentionTime are infinite.

  • Edit
    DependsOn
    DependsOn

    Gets or sets the tasks that this task depends on.

    public TaskDependencies DependsOn { get; set; }Public Property DependsOn As TaskDependencies

    Property Value

    • TaskDependencies
      TaskDependencies

    Remarks

    This task will not be scheduled until all tasks that it depends on have completed successfully. If any of those tasks fail and exhaust their retry counts, this task will never be scheduled. If the job does not have usesTaskDependencies set to true, and this element is present, the request fails with error code TaskDependenciesNotSpecifiedOnJob.

  • Edit
    DisplayName
    DisplayName

    Gets or sets a display name for the task.

    public string DisplayName { get; set; }Public Property DisplayName As String

    Property Value

    • String
      String

    Remarks

    The display name need not be unique and can contain any Unicode characters up to a maximum length of 1024.

  • Edit
    EnvironmentSettings
    EnvironmentSettings

    Gets or sets a list of environment variable settings for the task.

    public IList<EnvironmentSetting> EnvironmentSettings { get; set; }Public Property EnvironmentSettings As IList(Of EnvironmentSetting)

    Property Value

    • IList<EnvironmentSetting>
      IList(Of EnvironmentSetting)
  • Edit
    ExitConditions
    ExitConditions

    Gets or sets how the Batch service should respond when the task completes.

    public ExitConditions ExitConditions { get; set; }Public Property ExitConditions As ExitConditions

    Property Value

    • ExitConditions
      ExitConditions
  • Edit
    Id
    Id

    Gets or sets a string that uniquely identifies the task within the job.

    public string Id { get; set; }Public Property Id As String

    Property Value

    • String
      String

    Remarks

    The ID can contain any combination of alphanumeric characters including hyphens and underscores, and cannot contain more than 64 characters. The ID is case-preserving and case-insensitive (that is, you may not have two IDs within a job that differ only by case).

  • Edit
    MultiInstanceSettings
    MultiInstanceSettings

    Gets or sets an object that indicates that the task is a multi-instance task, and contains information about how to run the multi-instance task.

    public MultiInstanceSettings MultiInstanceSettings { get; set; }Public Property MultiInstanceSettings As MultiInstanceSettings

    Property Value

    • MultiInstanceSettings
      MultiInstanceSettings
  • Edit
    ResourceFiles
    ResourceFiles

    Gets or sets a list of files that the Batch service will download to the compute node before running the command line.

    public IList<ResourceFile> ResourceFiles { get; set; }Public Property ResourceFiles As IList(Of ResourceFile)

    Property Value

    • IList<ResourceFile>
      IList(Of ResourceFile)

    Remarks

    For multi-instance tasks, the resource files will only be downloaded to the compute node on which the primary task is executed.

  • Edit
    UserIdentity
    UserIdentity

    Gets or sets the user identity under which the task runs.

    public UserIdentity UserIdentity { get; set; }Public Property UserIdentity As UserIdentity

    Property Value

    • UserIdentity
      UserIdentity

    Remarks

    If omitted, the task runs as a non-administrative user unique to the task.
